nodes.name: sap.ui.vk.AuthorizationHandler
nodes.description:
Contract for authorization callback function

A callback function which can be implemented by an application to provide an authorization token. Such function receives single parameter which is connection URL and must return a promise which will be resolved when authorization token is obtained.

A sample implementation of authorization handler:

...
var viewer = new sap.ui.vk.Viewer();
viewer.setAuthorizationHandler(function(url) {
    var headers = new Headers();
    headers.append("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded");
    headers.append("Authorization", "Basic " + basicAuth);

    return fetch(accessTokenUrl, {
            method: "POST",
            body: "grant_type=client_credentials",
            headers: headers
        }).then(response => response.json())
});
...

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new AnimationPlayer.

The objects of this class contain necessary information to define how an animation sequence is played

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getAnimatedProperty

returnValue.description:
An object with the following properties:

  • For Translate, Rotate, Scale:
    • offsetToRest: float[] - translation, scale or rotation in quaternion form relative to the values of the rest transformation. If the property is not defined, null is assigned.
    • offsetToPrevious: float[] - translation, scale or rotation relative to the values at the end of the previous playback or the values of the rest transformation for the first playback. If the property is not defined, null is assigned. Rotation is assigned in the form in which the animation track is defined.
    • absolute: float[] - values of translation, scale or rotation in quaternion form in the parent's coordinate space.
    • world: float[] - values of translation, scale or rotation in quaternion form in the world coordinate space.
  • For Opacity:
    • offsetToRest: float - opacity relative to the rest opacity. If the property is not defined, null is assigned.
    • offsetToPrevious: float - opacity relative to the value at the end of the previous playback or the rest opacity for the first playback. If the property is not defined, null is assigned.
    • opacity: float - the node's own opacity
    • totalOpacity: float - the product of opacity values from all the ancestors and the node's own opacity.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: A node reference

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: A property name

methods.description: Get the animated property of a node at the current time, should be called after setTime.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.Annotation
symbols.description: Annotation allows applications to display custom html annotation on top of Viewport and associate it with 3D object

experimental.text: This class is experimental and might be modified or removed in future versions.

properties.name: animate
properties.description: Controls the animation of the annotation. If set to false then animation is not played.

properties.name: animationDelay
properties.description: Amount of time in seconds to wait before animation is played. Default value of -1 means that this is not set.

properties.name: annotationId
properties.description: Reference to the annotation Id

properties.name: display
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the annotation

properties.name: editable
properties.description: If annotation is editable then double click event is fired when user double clicks on the annotation and text editing is allowed by calling openEditor() method. If annotation is also selected then resize and reposition handles will be displayed.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sets the height of the annotation. This uses a scale of 0 to 1, 0% to 100% respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport. Negative values will be ignored.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Reference to the annotation name

properties.name: nodeRef
properties.description: Reference to the node that represents the annotation

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Controls the annotation is slected or unselected

properties.name: style
properties.description: The style of the annotation

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text that will be displayed in the annotation

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets the width of the annotation. This uses a scale of 0 to 1, 0% to 100% respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport. Negative values will be ignored.

properties.name: xCoordinate
properties.description: Sets the X Coordinate of the annotation. This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, left to right respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport.

properties.name: xOffset
properties.description: Sets horizontal offset of annotation's position relative to the point where it should be normally placed. Can be used to offset annotation from attachment node (if set). This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, left to right respectively.

properties.name: yCoordinate
properties.description: Sets the Y Coordinate of the annotation. This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, top to bottom respectively. This is relative to the Viewport's safe area if present, otherwise it is relative to the Viewport.

properties.name: yOffset
properties.description: Sets horizontal offset of annotation's position relative to the point where it should be normally placed. Can be used to offset annotation from attachment node (if set). This uses a scale of -0.5 to 0.5, top to bottom respectively.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.AuthorizationHandler
symbols.description:
Contract for authorization callback function

A callback function which can be implemented by an application to provide an authorization token. Such function receives single parameter which is connection URL and must return a promise which will be resolved when authorization token is obtained.

A sample implementation of authorization handler:

...
var viewer = new sap.ui.vk.Viewer();
viewer.setAuthorizationHandler(function(url) {
    var headers = new Headers();
    headers.append("Content-Type", "application/x-www-form-urlencoded");
    headers.append("Authorization", "Basic " + basicAuth);

    return fetch(accessTokenUrl, {
            method: "POST",
            body: "grant_type=client_credentials",
            headers: headers
        }).then(response => response.json())
});
...
symbols.title: interface sap.ui.vk.AuthorizationHandler

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:

  • sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren
  • sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors
  • sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection

methods.name: sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver

returnValue.description: The sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector class to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: resolver
parameters.description:
Object that defines how to find out the content manager class name.
If resolver is a function then this function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.ContentResource and returns a Promise that resolves with an object with the following properties:

  • dimension: int - dimension of the model. E.g. 2 or 3.
  • contentManagerClassName: string - name of content manager class to use for loading the content resource.
  • settings: object - optional settings specific to the content manager.
    See sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager.
If resolver is an object then it has the following properties:

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The pattern the sourceType property of the content resource is compared with.

parameters.name: dimension
parameters.description: Dimension of models of this source type. E.g. 2 or 3.

parameters.name: contentManagerClassName
parameters.description: Name of the content manager class to use for loading content resources of this type. E.g. sap.ui.vk.dvl.ContentManager, sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager, sap.ui.vk.ImageContentManager.

parameters.name: settings
parameters.description: Optional settings specific to the content manager class.

methods.description:
Adds a new content manager resolver.

The last added resolver will be executed the first.

Content manager resolver analyzes the content resource definition and returns the type of the content manager to use for loading the content resource.

The simplest resolver tests the content resource source type. The test can be either a string comparison or a regular expression.

A more sofisticated resolver is a function that can use the full content resource definition to find a proper content manager dynamically, e.g. the resolver can use the 'HEAD' HTTP request to get the 'Content-Type' header to find out the type of the content resource.

examples.data:
Example: Add a new content manager resolver based on string comparison of the sourceType property of the content resource.

sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver({
    pattern: "vds",
    dimension: 3,
    contentManagerClassName: "sap.ui.vk.dvl.ContentManager"
});

Example: Add a new content manager resolver based on regular expression test of the sourceType property of the content resource.

sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver({
    pattern: /^(png|jpg|jpeg|gif|bmp|tiff?|svg)$/,
    dimension: 2,
    contentManagerClassName: "sap.ui.vk.ImageContentManager"
});

Example: Add a new content manager resolver that makes a 'HEAD' HTTP request and checks the Content-Type header.

var loadCollada = function(parentNode, contentResource) {
    return new Promise(function(resolve, reject) {
        sap.ui.require(["sap/ui/vk/threejs/thirdparty/ColladaLoader"], function(ColladaLoader) {
            new THREE.ColladaLoader().load(contentResource.getSource(),
                function(collada) { // onload
                    parentNode.add(collada.scene);
                    resolve({
                        node: parentNode,
                        contentResource: contentResource
                    });
                },
                null,   // onprogress
                reject  // onfail
            );
        });
    });
};
var resolveContentManager = function(contentResource) {
    if (sap.ui.core.URI.isValid(contentResource.getSource())) {
        return new Promise(function(resolve, reject) {
            var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest();
            xhr.onerror = function(event) {
                reject();
            };
            xhr.onload = function(event) {
                if (xhr.status === 200 && xhr.getResponseHeader("Content-Type") === "model/vnd.collada+xml") {
                    resolve({
                        dimension: 3,
                        contentManagerClassName: "sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager",
                        settings: {
                            loader: loadCollada
                        }
                    });
                } else {
                    reject();
                }
            };
            xhr.open("HEAD", contentResource.getSource(), true);
            xhr.send(null);
        });
    } else {
        return Promise.reject();
    }
};
sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver(resolveContentManager);

Example: Add a new content manager resolver to load content resources with three.js objects.

var loadThreeJSObject = function(parentNode, contentResource) {
    parentNode.add(contentResource.getSource());
    return Promise.resolve({
        node: parentNode,
        contentResource: contentResource
    });
};
var resolveThreeJSContentResource = function(contentResource) {
    if (contentResource.getSource() instanceof THREE.Object3D) {
        return Promise.resolve({
            dimension: 3,
            contentManagerClassName: "sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager",
            settings: {
                loader: loadThreeJSObject
            }
        });
    } else {
        return Promise.reject();
    }
};
ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver(resolveThreeJSContentResource);
var torusGeometry = new THREE.TorusBufferGeometry(10, 3, 16, 100);
var torus = new THREE.Object3D()
    .add(new THREE.LineSegments(
        torusGeometry,
        new THREE.LineBasicMaterial({
            color: 0xffffff,
            transparent: true,
            opacity: 0.5
        })
    ))
    .add(new THREE.Mesh(
        torusGeometry,
        new THREE.MeshPhongMaterial({
            color: 0x156289,
            emissive: 0x072534,
            side: THREE.DoubleSide,
            shading: THREE.FlatShading
        })
    ));
contentConnector.addContentResource(
    new ContentResource({
        source: torus,
        sourceId: "abc",
        name: "Torus"
    })
);

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ContentResource
symbols.description: Specifies a resource to load.

properties.name: activateView
properties.description: Optional parameter with view id which shall be activated when scene is loaded.

properties.name: enableLogger
properties.description: Optional boolean parameter to enable detailed logging. Can be used to track performance issues during data streaming from SAP 3D Visualisation Service.

properties.name: includeAnimation
properties.description: Send structural data for animation objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

properties.name: includeBackground
properties.description: If set to true, will return nodes with the type background

properties.name: includeHidden
properties.description: Send structural data for hidden objects, if false they will be omitted, reducing data size. Default: true.

properties.name: includeParametric
properties.description: If set to true, will load parametric nodes

properties.name: localMatrix
properties.description: The local transformation matrix of the node created for this content resource.

properties.name: metadataFilter
properties.description: Optional metadata filter that can trim the tree before sending to the client only keeping nodes that passed the filter and their parents. Default: null. Format: Comma-separated list of meta.category1.tag1.value1, meta.category2.tag2.value2. "meta." is the prefix and all metadata filters must start with it. Multiple filters are supported, they are combined using `OR` operator. Includes parent nodes of matching nodes (e.g. breadcrumb) even if they dont pass the filter.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the node created for this content resource.

properties.name: password
properties.description: The password to use when opening the resource.

properties.name: pushPMI
properties.description: If set to true, elements for PMI rendering content will be returned. Default: false.

properties.name: pushViewGroups
properties.description: If set to true, infomation of view groups will be returned. Default: true.

properties.name: source
properties.description: The source URL or the File object of the content resource/file to load from. The source may be omitted if a grouping node is needed.

properties.name: sourceId
properties.description: The unique ID of the content resource.

properties.name: sourceType
properties.description:
The source type of the content resource. Valid types:

  • vds
  • svg
  • png
  • jpg
  • jpeg
  • gif
  • bmp
  • tif*
  • tiff*
  • stream
The source type may be omitted if this is a grouping content node.
NOTE: The tif and tiff image formats are not supported on all web browsers.

properties.name: useSecureConnection
properties.description: If set to false, unsecure connections will be used. Default: true.

properties.name: veid
properties.description: Id of scene to retrieve tree for. Mandatory for the stream source type.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new content resource. sIdis generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given. Note: this can be omitted, regardless of whether mSettings will be provided or not.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: An optional map/JSON object with initial property values, aggregated objects etc. for the new content resource.

parameters.name: oScope
parameters.description: scope An object for resolving string-based type and formatter references in bindings.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ContentResource.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler
symbols.description:
Contract for objects that implement decryption.

An interface for an object provided by an application to decrypt content of encrypted models.

Content is encrypted with the AES128 algorithm in the CBC mode.

A key is derived with the PBKDF2 algorithm by applying the HMAC -SHA256 function 10,000 times.

A sample implementation and usage of the sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler interface with the asmCrypto library:

...
<script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/asmCrypto/0.16.4/asmcrypto.js"></script>
...
var decryptionHandler = {
    deriveKey: function(salt, password) {
        try {
            return asmCrypto.PBKDF2_HMAC_SHA256.bytes(password, salt, 10000, 16);
        } catch (ex) {
            return null;
        }
    },
    decrypt: function(key, iv, input) {
        try {
            return asmCrypto.AES_CBC.decrypt(input, key, true, iv);
        } catch (ex) {
            return null;
        }
    }
};
...
var viewer = new sap.ui.vk.Viewer();
viewer.setDecryptionHandler(decryptionHandler);
var contentResource = new sap.ui.vk.ContentResource({
    source: "http://my-web-server.com/my-encrypted-model.vds",
    sourceType: "vds",
    sourceId: "abc",
    password: "abracadabra"
});
viewer.addContentResource(contentResource);

methods.name: decrypt

returnValue.description: The decrypted buffer.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The derived key generated by the previous call to sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.deriveKey.

parameters.name: iv
parameters.description: The 128-bit initialization vector .

parameters.name: encryptedData
parameters.description: The encrypted buffer.

methods.description: Decrypts the input buffer with the AES128 algorithm in the CBC mode.

methods.name: deriveKey

returnValue.description: A derived 128-bit key that should be passed to subsequent calls to sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.decrypt.

parameters.name: salt
parameters.description: Random data that is used as an additional input to a one-way function that "hashes" a password or passphrase.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: A password used for encryption/decryption.

methods.description:
Generates a cryptographic session key derived from a base data value.

The key must be derived with the PBKDF2 algorithm by applying the HMAC -SHA256 function 10,000 times.

The resulting 128-bit key should be passed to subseqeunt calls to sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler.decrypt.

symbols.title: interface sap.ui.vk.DecryptionHandler

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.dvl.LayerProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a proxy object to the layer in the node hierarchy.

Layer is a list of nodes. One node hierarchy can have multiple layers. One node can be included in multiple layers.

Objects of this type should only be created with the sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy method and destroyed with the sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy method.

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.description: The node reference whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The node reference whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.dvl.BaseNodeProxy, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

methods.name: findNodesByName

returnValue.description: A list of IDs belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 

query = {
	value: string | string[],
	predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
	caseSensitive: true | false
}

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the name of a node or names of nodes. If no value is specified, then all nodes in the scene will be returned.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for nodes with names that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for nodes with names containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search for nodes with names starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via node name.

methods.name: getAncestors

methods.name: getViewInfo

returnValue.description:
JSON-like object which holds the current view information. See setViewInfo. In addition to properties defined in setViewInfo the output from getViewInfo contains camera view and projection matrices 

  {
    ...
    camera: {
      ...
      matrices: {
        view:       [number, ...],
        projection: [number, ...],
      }
      ...
    },
    ...
  }

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query object which indicates what information to be retrieved.

parameters.name: camera
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve camera information.

parameters.name: matrices
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve camera view and projection matrices.

parameters.name: useTransitionCamera
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve the transition camera properties instead of regular one's.

parameters.name: animation
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve animation information.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve visibility information.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve the complete visibility definition or just the difference.

methods.description: Retrieves information about the current camera view in the scene, and saves the information in a JSON-like object. The information can then be used at a later time to restore the scene to the same camera view using the setViewInfo method.

parameters.description: Camera zoom factor. Applicable only to orthographic cameras.

parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing the animation information.

parameters.description: Step VE ID. If it is omitted then procedure and step indices are used.

parameters.description: Procedure index in the list of procedures.

parameters.description: Step index in the list of steps in the procedure.

parameters.description: Time at which to activate the step.

parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing the visibility information.

parameters.description: List of Ids of visible nodes.

parameters.description: List of Ids of hidden nodes.

parameters.name: changes
parameters.description: List of Ids of nodes with inverted visibility.

parameters.description: Fly-to animation duration in seconds.

methods.description:
Sets the current scene to use the camera view information acquired from the getViewInfo method.
Internally, the setViewInfo method activates certain steps at certain animation times, and then changes the camera position, rotation and field of view (FOV) / zoom factor.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.FlexibleControlLayoutData
symbols.description: Holds layout data for the FlexibleControl contents. Allowed size values are numeric values ending in "px" and "%" and the special case "auto". (The CSS value "auto" is used internally to recalculate the size of the content dynamically and is not directly set as style property.)

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.LayerProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a proxy object to the layer in the node hierarchy.

Layer is a list of nodes. One node hierarchy can have multiple layers. One node can be included in multiple layers.

Objects of this type should only be created with the sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createLayerProxy method and destroyed with the sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyLayerProxy method.

constructor.description:

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vk.Material

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport
symbols.description:
Enables loading, pan, zoom and overlay capabilities for a subset of file formats capable of being loaded into a browser natively.

viewer.loadContent("https://www.google.co.nz/images/srpr/logo11w.png", "png", true);

properties.name: limitZoomOut
properties.description: Limit the abbility to zoom out. If enabled the zoom out stops if the image size reaches 25% of the full view (best fit).

associations.name: contentConnector
associations.description: An association to the ContentConnector instance that manages content resources.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new Native Viewport control, generated automatically if no ID is given.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new Native Viewport control.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new NativeViewport.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: move
events.description: Raised when the display position or magnification of the image in the Native Viewport changes.

events.name: resize
events.description: Raised when the display size of the image in the Native Viewport changes.

methods.name: attachMove

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the move event of this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport itself.

Raised when the display position or magnification of the image in the Native Viewport changes.

methods.name: attachResize

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the resize event of this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport itself.

Raised when the display size of the image in the Native Viewport changes.

methods.name: beginGesture

returnValue.description: this

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: x-coordinate in screen space.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: y-coordinate in screen space.

methods.description: Marks the start of the current gesture operation.

methods.name: detachMove

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description:
Detaches event handler fnFunction from the move event of this sap.ui.vk.NativeViewport.

The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

methods.name: detachResize

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

Provides the ability to explore a Scene object's node structure.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy.

constructor.description:

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created via a call to sap.ui.vk.Scene.getDefaultNodeHierarchy.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: enumerateAncestors

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: The reference object of a node whose ancestor nodes we want enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the ancestor nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the ancestor nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the reference objects of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the reference objects of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child reference objects are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

methods.name: findNodesById

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the VE IDs search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 

query = {
	source: string (if not specified, the query returns an empty array), 

	type: string (if not specified, the query returns an empty array), 

	fields: field[]
	}

  • field.name
    A string containing the name of the VE ID. If no value is specified, then the query will return an empty array.
  • field.value
    A string representing the search keyword. If no value is specified, it defaults to empty string.
    The following example shows a string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
  • field.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for IDs with names that exactly match the provided string.
    Using "contains" will search for IDs with names containing the provided string.
    Using "startsWith" will search for IDs with names starting with the provided string.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • field.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Searches for VE IDs, and returns a list of reference objects of nodes with VE IDs matching the search. The query is run specifically against VE ID structures, which are strictly related to VDS4 models.

methods.name: findNodesByMetadata

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 

query = {
  category: string,
  key: string,
  value: string | string[],
  predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
  caseSensitive: true | false
}

NOTE: query.predicate and query.caseSensitive refer to query.value.
  • query.category
    A string indicating the name of the metadata category.
    If no value is specified for query.category, all nodes in the scene will be returned in the search.

  • query.key
    A string indicating the key which belongs to the metadata category specified in query.category. You can only use query.key if query.category has been specified.
    If no value is specified for query.key, then all nodes grouped under the specified category will be returned in the search.

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the value or values associated with query.key. You can only use query.value in the search if query.key has been specified.
    If no value is specified for query.value, then all nodes containing the specified key will be returned, regardless of what the value of the key is.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for key values that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for key values containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search key values starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via metadata information.

methods.name: findNodesByName

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 

query = {
	value: string | string[],
	predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
	caseSensitive: true | false
}

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the name of a node or names of nodes. If no value is specified, then all nodes in the scene will be returned.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for nodes with names that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for nodes with names containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search for nodes with names starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via node name.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.NodeProxy
symbols.description:
Provides a proxy object to the node in the node hierarchy.

Objects of this type should only be created with the sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.createNodeProxy method. and destroyed with the sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.destroyNodeProxy method.

properties.name: closed
properties.description: The indicator showing if the node is closed. This property is read-only.

properties.name: hasChildren
properties.description: The indicator showing if the node has child nodes. This property is read-only.

properties.name: localMatrix
properties.description: The local transformation matrix of the node.

properties.name: material
properties.description: The material of the node (optional).

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the node. This property is read-only.

properties.name: nodeMetadata
properties.description: The node metadata. This property is read-only.

properties.name: nodeRef
properties.description: The node reference. This property is read-only.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: The node opacity.

properties.name: tintColor
properties.description: The tint color.

properties.name: tintColorABGR
properties.description:
The tint color.

The tint color is a 32-bit integer in the ABGR notation, where A is amount of blending between material color and tint color.

properties.name: veIds
properties.description: The node VE IDs. This property is read-only.

properties.name: worldMatrix
properties.description: The world transformation matrix of the node.

parameters.name: sId

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new Notifications.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: allMessagesCleared
events.description: This event will be fired when all messages in the log are deleted.

events.name: messageAdded
events.description: This event will be fired when a new log message is added.

parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.Notifications itself

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.Notifications itself.

This event will be fired when all messages in the log are deleted.

properties.description: The border color of the OverlayArea.

properties.description: The non-select color of the OverlayArea in case non-selection de-highligthing is desired.

properties.name: colorSelect
properties.description: The select color of the OverlayArea in case selection highligthing is desired.

properties.name: deltaColorHot
properties.description: Color or color delta when object is hovered. Color deltas can be declared in the format RHLSA(;;;)

properties.name: key
properties.description: Unique identifier for the object. This is optional. If not provided the default identifier sId is used. However, sId is generated if template binding is used and thus it is not stable. Provide the key if the object really needs a unique and stable identifier.

properties.name: position
properties.description: The position array for the OverlayArea. The format is "x0;y0;0;...;xN,yN,0".

properties.name: select
properties.description: set to true if the element is selected

properties.description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display a popup containing information around the step that is playing. If set to true, then the popup is rendered. If set to false, the popup is hidden.

properties.description: Indicates that the Step Navigation control should display thumbnails. If set to true, then thumbnails are rendered. If set to false, then thumbnails are hidden.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.svg.ContentManager
symbols.description:
Provides a content manager object that uses to load 2D content.

When registering a content manager resolver with sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver you can pass a function that will load a model and merge it into the three.js scene.

Documentation links:

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the ancestore nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies of the ancestor nodes are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

methods.name: enumerateChildren

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description:
The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

methods.name: findNodesByName

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 

query = {
	value: string | string[],
	predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
	caseSensitive: true | false
}

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the name of a node or names of nodes. If no value is specified, then all nodes in the scene will be returned.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for nodes with names that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for nodes with names containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search for nodes with names starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via node name.

symbols.description:
Provides a simple, lightweight proxy object to a node in a node hierarchy.

The objects of this class should not be created directly, and should only be created through the use of the following methods:

  • sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateChildren
  • sap.ui.vk.NodeHierarchy.enumerateAncestors
  • sap.ui.vk.ViewStateManager.enumerateSelection

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.threejs.ContentManager
symbols.description:
Provides a content manager object that uses the three.js library to load 3D files.

When registering a content manager resolver with sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver you can pass a function that will load a model and merge it into the three.js scene.

The loader function takes two parameters:

  • parentNode - THREE.Group - a grouping node to merge the content into
  • contentResource - sap.ui.vk.ContentResource - a content resource to load
The loader function returns a Promise object. If the loading the model succeeds the promise object resolves with a value with the following structure:
  • node - THREE.Group - the grouping node to which the content is merged into. It should be the parentNode parameter that was passed to the loader function.
  • contentResource - sap.ui.vk.ContentResource - the content resource that was loaded.


Documentation links:
  • sap.ui.vk.ContentConnector.addContentManagerResolver for an example.

methods.description:
Enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method enumerates the ancestor nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function, to which it passes the ancestor nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to callback are temporary objects, they are reset after each call to the callback function.
The ancestor nodes are enumerated starting from the top level node, and progresses down the node hierarchy.

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

The reference object of a node whose child nodes we want enumerated.
When nodeRef is specified, the child nodes of this node are enumerated.
When no nodeRef is specified, only the top level nodes are enumerated.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: A function to call when the child nodes are enumerated. The function takes one parameter of type sap.ui.vk.BaseNodeProxy, or string if parameter passNodeRef parameter is true.

parameters.name: stepIntoClosedNodes
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to enumerate the child nodes if the node is closed.
If true, the children of that closed node will be enumerated
If false, the children of that node will not be enumerated

parameters.name: passNodeRef
parameters.description:
Indicates whether to pass the node references of the child nodes, or the whole node proxy to the callback function.
If true, then only the node references of the child nodes are passed to the callback function.
If false, then the node proxies created from the child node references are passed to the callback function.

methods.description:
Enumerates the child nodes of a particular node in the Scene object.

This method gets the child nodes of a particular node, and then calls the callback function to which it passes the child nodes to one by one.
The BaseNodeProxy objects passed to the callback fuction are temporary objects, which are reset after each call to the callback function.

methods.name: findNodesByName

returnValue.description: A list of reference objects belonging to nodes that matched the search criteria.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
JSON object containing the search parameters.
The following example shows what the structure of the query object should look like: 

query = {
	value: string | string[],
	predicate: "equals" | "contains" | "startsWith",
	caseSensitive: true | false
}

  • query.value
    A string or an array of strings containing the name of a node or names of nodes. If no value is specified, then all nodes in the scene will be returned.
    The following example shows a single string being passed in: 
    value: "Box #14"
    The following example shows an array of strings being passed in: 
    value: ["Box #3", "box #4", "BOX #5"]
  • query.predicate
    Represents a search mode. The available search modes are "equals", "contains", and "startsWith".
    Using "equals" will search for nodes with names that exactly match the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "contains" will search for nodes with names containing all or part of the provided string or array of strings.
    Using "startsWith" will search for nodes with names starting with the provided string or array of strings.
    If no value is specified, the search mode will default to "equals".

  • query.caseSensitive
    Indicates whether the search should be case sensitive or not.
    If true, the search will be case sensitive, and false indicates otherwise.
    If no value is specified, caseSensitive will default to false (that is, the search will be a case-insensitive search).

methods.description: Finds nodes in a scene via node name.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a ThreeJs viewport.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getViewInfo

returnValue.description:
JSON-like object which holds the current view information. See setViewInfo. In addition to properties defined in setViewInfo the output from getViewInfo contains camera view and projection matrices 

  {
    ...
    camera: {
      ...
      matrices: {
        view:       [number, ...],
        projection: [number, ...],
      }
      ...
    },
    ...
  }

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query object which indicates what information to be retrieved.

parameters.name: camera
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve camera information.

parameters.name: matrices
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve camera view and projection matrices.

parameters.name: useTransitionCamera
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve the transition camera properties instead of regular one's.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve visibility information.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve the complete visibility definition or just the difference.

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: Indicator to retrieve selection information.

methods.description: Retrieves information about the current camera view in the scene, and saves the information in a JSON-like object. The information can then be used at a later time to restore the scene to the same camera view using the setViewInfo method.

methods.name: projectToScreen

returnValue.description: Object with x and y screen coordinates in pixels of projected point. Third parameter 'depth' is distance from the point to the camera normalized to camera's frustrum (range from -1 to +1). More information about normalized coordinates can be found here: https://learnopengl.com/Getting-started/Coordinate-Systems

parameters.description: X coordinate in world space

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate in world space

parameters.description: Camera to be used with calculation of projection

returnValue.description: this to allow method chaining.

parameters.name: viewInfo
parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing view information acquired using the getViewInfo method.

parameters.name: camera
parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing the camera information.

parameters.name: rotation
parameters.description: Rotation defined in Aircraft principal axes .

parameters.name: yaw
parameters.description: Angle around the vertical axis in degrees.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: Angle around the lateral axis in degrees.

parameters.name: roll
parameters.description: Angle around the longitudinal axis in degrees.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Position defined in 3-dimensional space.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: X coordinate.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: Y coordinate.

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: Z coordinate.

parameters.name: bindingType
parameters.description: Camera field of view binding type.

parameters.name: projectionType
parameters.description: Camera projection type.

parameters.name: fieldOfView
parameters.description: Camera field of view in degrees. Applicable only to perspective cameras.

parameters.name: zoomFactor
parameters.description: Camera zoom factor. Applicable only to orthographic cameras.

parameters.name: animation
parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing the animation information.

parameters.name: stepVeId
parameters.description: Step VE ID. If it is omitted then procedure and step indices are used.

parameters.name: procedureIndex
parameters.description: Procedure index in the list of procedures.

parameters.name: stepIndex
parameters.description: Step index in the list of steps in the procedure.

parameters.name: animationTime
parameters.description: Time at which to activate the step.

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing the visibility information.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: If the mode equals to complete then the visible and hidden fields are defined. If the mode equals differences then the changes field is defined.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: List of Ids of visible nodes.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: List of Ids of hidden nodes.

parameters.name: changes
parameters.description: List of Ids of nodes with inverted visibility.

parameters.name: selection
parameters.description: A JSON-like object containing the selection information.

parameters.name: selected
parameters.description: List of Ids of selected nodes.

parameters.name: outlined
parameters.description: List of Ids of outlined nodes.

parameters.name: flyToDuration
parameters.description: Fly-to animation duration in seconds.

methods.description:
Sets the current scene to use the camera view information acquired from the getViewInfo method.
Internally, the setViewInfo method activates certain steps at certain animation times, and then changes the camera position, rotation and field of view (FOV) / zoom factor.

methods.name: zoomTo

returnValue.description: this

parameters.name: what
parameters.description: What set of nodes to zoom to.

parameters.name: nodeRef
parameters.description: Is used if what == (sap.ui.vk.ZoomTo.Node || ZoomTo.NodeSetIsolation)

parameters.name: crossFadeSeconds
parameters.description: Time to perform the "fly to" animation. Set to 0 to do this immediately.

parameters.name: margin
parameters.description: Margin. Set to 0 to zoom to the entire screen.

methods.description: Zooms the scene to a bounding box created from a particular set of nodes.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new AxisAngleRotationTool.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: rotated
events.description:
This event will be fired when rotation finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties:

  • node: any - A node reference.
  • angle: float - An angle of rotation about the axis.
  • azimuth: float - An azimuth of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • elevation: float - An elevation of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • axis: float[] - An axis of rotation in cartesian coordinates in the parent's space.
An axis of rotation in animation keys is stored in cartesian coordinates, in UI an axis of rotation is displayed in polar coordinates using azimuth and elevation.

events.name: rotating
events.description:
This event will be fired when rotation finished. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties:

  • node: any - A node reference.
  • angle: float - An angle of rotation about the axis.
  • azimuth: float - An azimuth of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • elevation: float - An elevation of the axis of rotation in degrees in the parent's space.
  • axis: float[] - An axis of rotation in cartesian coordinates in the parent's space.
An axis of rotation in animation keys is stored in cartesian coordinates, in UI an axis of rotation is displayed in polar coordinates using azimuth and elevation.

Attaches event handler fnFunction to the moving event of this sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.tools.MoveTool itself.

This event will be fired when movement occurs. This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has four properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, translate relative to rest position in local coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, translate relative to end position of previous sequence or rest position if no previous sequence in local coordinates {float[]} absolute, translate in parent coordinates {float[]} world, translate in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position translation in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position translation in current coordinates

This event contains parameter 'nodesProperties' that is array of objects, each object has five properties: {any} node: node reference, {float[]} offsetToRest, quaternion relative to rest position in parent coordinates {float[]} offsetToPrevious, euler rotation relative to end position of previous sequence, or euler rotation relative to rest position if no previous sequence in parent coordinates {float[]} absolute, quaternion in parent coordinates {float[]} world, quaternion in world coordinates {float[]} restDifference, change of rest position quaternion in parent coordinates {float[]} restDifferenceInCoordinates, change of rest position in euler rotation in current coordinates

events.description: This event will be fired when rotation finished. Gets current value of property allowContextMenu.

Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click

Default value is true.

returnValue.description: Value of property autoResetValues

methods.description:
Gets current value of property autoResetValues.

Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled

Default value is true.

methods.name: getAxis

returnValue.description: Value of property axis

methods.description:
Gets current value of property axis.

Controls which axis are rotatable around. Can be All, X, Y, or Z

Default value is All.

methods.name: getCoordinateSystem

returnValue.description: Value of property coordinateSystem

methods.description:
Gets current value of property coordinateSystem.

Select coordinate system in which this tool operates. Can be Local, World, Parent, Screen or Custom

Default value is World.

methods.name: getEnableSnapping

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSnapping

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableSnapping.

Determines if snapping when rotating is enabled

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableStepping

returnValue.description: Value of property enableStepping

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableStepping.

If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change

Default value is false.

symbols.description: Tool to rotate scene in turntable mode

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new tool instance. sIdis generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given. Note: this can be omitted, regardless of whether mSettings will be provided or not.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: An optional map/JSON object with initial property values, aggregated objects etc. for the new tool instance.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new RotateTurntableTool tool.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.tools.ScaleTool
symbols.description: Tool to scale 3D objects

properties.name: allowContextMenu
properties.description: Whether or not to allow context menu on right-click

properties.name: autoResetValues
properties.description: Determines if auto reset values mode is enabled

properties.name: coordinateSystem
properties.description: Select coordinate system in which this tool operates. Can be Local, World, Parent, Screen or Custom

properties.name: enableSnapping
properties.description: Enable snapping if set true

properties.name: enableStepping
properties.description: If set to true values will change in round number increments instead of continual change

properties.name: nodeSet
properties.description: Determine what set of nodes will be transformed with this tool

properties.name: nonUniformScaleEnabled
properties.description: If set to true then this tool will enable scaling along a single axis, otherwise it will scale objects along all three axes proportionaly

properties.name: placementMode
properties.description: Sets the placement mode. Can be Default, ObjectCenter, or OnScreen

properties.name: showEditingUI
properties.description: Display text box with current value, which can also be used to directly modify the value

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new content resource. sIdis generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given. Note: this can be omitted, regardless of whether mSettings will be provided or not.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: An optional map/JSON object with initial property values, aggregated objects etc. for the new tool instance.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ScaleTool.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.Viewer
symbols.description: Provides simple 3D visualization capability by connecting, configuring and presenting the essential Visualization Toolkit controls a single composite control.

properties.name: enableNotifications
properties.description: Disables the Message Popover Control

properties.name: enableOverlay
properties.description: Enables or disables the Overlay control

properties.name: enableProgressIndicator
properties.description: Enable / disable progress indicator for downloading and rendering VDS files

properties.name: enableSceneTree
properties.description: Disables the scene tree control Button on the menu

properties.name: enableStepNavigation
properties.description: Disables the Step Navigation Control Button on the menu

properties.name: enableToolbar
properties.description: Shows or hides Toolbar control

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the Viewer control

properties.name: hotspotColor
properties.description: Color used for highlighting Smart2D hotspots in the CSS Color format.

properties.name: hotspotColorABGR
properties.description: Color used for highlighting Smart2D hotspots in the ABGR format.

properties.name: overlayStepNavigation
properties.description: If enabled the Step Navigation will be overlayed on top of the viewport. Only set this during initialization. Will not work when set at runtime.

properties.name: recursiveSelection
properties.description: Whether or not we want ViewStateManager to have recursive selection.

properties.name: runtimeSettings
properties.description:
Optional Emscripten runtime module settings. A JSON object with the following properties:

  • totalMemory {int} size of Emscripten module memory in bytes, default value: 512 MB.
  • logElementId {string} ID of a textarea DOM element to write the log to.
  • statusElementId {string} ID of a DOM element to write the status messages to.
Emscripten runtime module settings cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

properties.name: shouldTrackVisibilityChanges
properties.description: Whether or not we want ViewStateManager to keep track of visibility changes.

properties.name: showAllHotspots
properties.description: Enables or disables showing of all hotspots

properties.name: showSceneTree
properties.description: Shows or hides the scene tree control

properties.name: showStepNavigation
properties.description: Shows or hides the Step Navigation Control

properties.name: showStepNavigationThumbnails
properties.description: Shows or hides the Step Navigation thumbnails

properties.name: toolbarTitle
properties.description: The toolbar title

properties.name: webGLContextAttributes
properties.description:
Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:

  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other WebGL context attributes are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the Viewer control

aggregations.name: contentResources
aggregations.description: Content resources to load and display in the Viewer control.

parameters.description: ID for the new Viewer control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new Viewer control

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.vk.Viewer itself

methods.description:
Attaches event handler fnFunction to the urlClicked event of this sap.ui.vk.Viewer.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.vk.Viewer itself.

This event will be fired when a URL in a note is clicked.

Default value is {}.

methods.name: getWebGLContextAttributes

returnValue.description: Value of property webGLContextAttributes

methods.description:
Gets current value of property webGLContextAttributes.

Optional WebGL context attributes. A JSON object with the following boolean properties:

  • antialias {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will attempt to perform antialiased rendering if possible.
  • alpha {boolean} default value true. If set to true, the context will have an alpha (transparency) channel.
  • premultipliedAlpha {boolean} default value false. If set to true, the color channels in the framebuffer will be stored premultiplied by the alpha channel to improve performance.
Other WebGL context attributes are also supported. WebGL context attributes cannot be changed after the control is fully initialized.

Default value is ...see text or source.

symbols.title: class sap.ui.vk.Viewer

symbols.name: sap.ui.vk.ViewGallery
symbols.description: Enables capabilities for navigating and activating procedures and steps contained in a single 3D scene.

properties.name: enableViewReordering
properties.description: Indicates that the View Gallery control should allow view reordering

properties.name: selectedViewGroupIndex
properties.description: Index of selected view group

properties.name: selectedViewIndex
properties.description: Index of selected view

properties.name: showAnimationTimeSlider
properties.description: Indicates that the View Gallery control should display animation slider showing time of animation in current view.

properties.name: showThumbnailContainer
properties.description: Indicates that the View Gallery control should display thumbnails

properties.name: showToolbar
properties.description: Indicates that the View Gallery control should display toolbar

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: Sets the transparency level of the viewgallery. Range is 0-1, with 1 being 100% opaque and 0 being 0% opaque

aggregations.name: container
aggregations.description: sap.m.ScrollContainer used to render a list of thumbnails for the available steps.

aggregations.name: toolbar
aggregations.description: sap.m.Toolbar used to render the entire View Gallery control's content.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control. This ID is generated automatically if no ID is provided.

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new View Gallery control.

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ViewGallery.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.
